metadata.title: CVE-2019-13057 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the server in OpenLDAP before 2.4.48. When theserver administrator delegates rootDN (database admin) privileges forcertain databases but wants to maintain isolation (e.g., for multi-tenantdeployments), slapd does not properly stop a rootDN from requestingauthorization as an identity from another database during a SASL bind orwith a proxyAuthz (RFC 4370) control. (It is not a common configuration todeploy a system where the server administrator and a DB administrator enjoydifferent levels of trust.)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13057` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-utils - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.6
libldap-2.4-2 - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.6
slapd - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.6
slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openldap package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.6').
